verse.name: v1
verse.lines: On yonder hill there stands a maiden Who she is I do not know; I shall court her, for her beauty, She must answer yes or no,

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Oh, Oh, no John, No John, No John, No.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Madam, on thy face is beauty On thy lips wild roses grow, Madam, I would be thy lover, Madam, answer yes or no,

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Madam, on thy face is beauty, At thy bosom lilies grow, In your bedroom there is pleasure, Shall I view it? Yes or no.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Madam, I will give you jewels I will make you rich and free; I will give you silk and satins Madam, if you lie with me.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: My husband is a Spanish captain, Went to sea a month ago. First he kissed me, then he left me, Bade me always answer "No!"

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Madam, may I tie your garter Just an inch above your knee? If my hand should slip a little farther, Would you think it ill of me?

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: My love and I went to bed together, There we lay till the cocks did crow; Open your arms my dearest darling, Open your arms and let me go.
